jobs.title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🏆 What’s the opportunity?

Embark on a pioneering journey to drive air freight and logistics digital transformation. As a proud member of a rapidly expanding Series B company, you'll collaborate with a team supported by prominent Venture Capital firms like Index and Bessemer.

As a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer, you will engage with diverse stakeholders, contributing to our company cloud infrastructure, and ensuring, at the same time, the quality of the work. You will experience a culture of open communication, providing and receiving insightful feedback during retrospectives, one-on-ones, and regular performance reviews.

We're advocates of Scrum. If you're familiar with the Scrum guide or have been part of an efficient Scrum team, you'll resonate with our working style. We hope you'll embody our core values: commitment, courage, focus, openness, and respect.

At our core, we believe in a harmonious blend of diligent work, continuous feedback, and the right amount of fun. Ready to join us and revolutionize how airlines handle cargo?

🌍You can work from (almost) anywhere in Europe and South Africa. Please check here if the country you are in is on our hiring list. We are a remote company, but regularly meet in person, too.

🎬 A snapshot of what you will be doing here:

You will take charge of the infrastructure we are running our software platform on. Our mission is to operate a lean multicloud platform that allows us to run workloads according to their needs (for example cost-effective development workflows and highly-available production workloads).

You will work closely with our software engineers, who operate in a “you build it, you run it” mindset to remove infrastructure obstacles and improve the developer experience. The cloud infrastructure roadmap will be defined by you together with our CTO Mike and you will report directly to him.

Your responsibilities:

  • Operate our cloud infrastructure on GCP and Hetzner including multiple Kubernetes clusters (GKE, Rancher)

  • Run and maintain infrastructure components hosted within Kubernetes, for example Hashicorp Vault, redis and nginx-ingress

  • Keep track of what our infrastructure is doing through Grafana dashboards and alerts.

  • Assess security risks and actively increase security of our operations by thinking about refined approaches to authorization, network segmentation or encryption (during transport and at rest).

  • Identify and implement improvements across our infrastructure stack. More infrastructure as code, better alerting, reduction of cloud cost.

🕵🏼‍♀️ We are looking for individuals with:

  • At least 2 years of experience as cloud infrastructure engineer with one of the major cloud providers.

  • A strong growth mindset. You are biased to action, resilient and a self-starter who is excited about tackling new challenges and always keeps the user in mind.

  • Exceptional written and verbal skills with fluency in English (Bonus points for love of emojis 😎). You’re a great communicator and easily build relationships across internal stakeholders in a remote-first setup.

  • An ability to embrace uncertainty and display a high level of adaptability.

  • A willingness to learn and openness to accepting feedback, generously giving their own in return.

  • Flexibility to run deployments involving downtime outside of core operation hours.

❤️ We think you will love working here if:

  • You treasure building deep, trusting relationships with your team and managers.

  • Innovation excites you, and you’re always on the lookout for opportunities to enhance processes, starting small and climbing your way up to the architecture.

  • Remote work is not just a convenience; it's a dynamic challenge you're eager to navigate and crack open.

  • Ownership, commitment, and the joy of exceeding expectations define your work ethic.

  • Personal growth is paramount, and you're not afraid to step out of your comfort zone.

  • Feedback is a two-way street for you; you believe in giving as much as you take.

  • Voicing well-informed opinions, backed by data, is second nature to you.

✨ We are currently offering the following benefits globally:

  • Company-wide:

    • Home office budget of €650 which can be used to purchase items such as a desk, chair, mouse, keyboard & monitor, etc. On top of that, choose between MacBook Air (M3 chip) or Dell XPS and have it delivered prior to your starting date.

    • Offsite fun & team trips since there’s nothing more important than culture and team spirit. We meet twice a year as a company and also have opportunities to  meet as a team. Click here to watch a video from one of our early offsite events.

    • Unlimited co-working options through our partner desana all around the world.

    • 24 paid vacation days on top of the bank holidays (specific to the country you are in) and special leaves.

  • Engineering-specific:

    • A GitHub Copilot license, your new AI-powered pair programmer who never complains about coffee breaks.- A full IntelliJ PyCharm license to elevate your Python development.

    • Prefer another tool like Visual Studio Code or Neovim? No problem, we are not strict about this.

🤔 What is so exciting about working in the air cargo industry?

Imagine a world without a Skyscanner or Kayak when trying to book your next holiday. That is exactly where the air cargo industry finds itself today.  With the backing of internationally prominent investors, we are shaping the future of how the air cargo industry will work by providing a tech solution for a currently very manual and time-intensive process for airlines and freight forwarders to book air cargo, an industry which is worth almost $123bn. Our solution allows users to transparently and efficiently search for and book air cargo within seconds! If you want to be part of a company pioneering the way in the future of air cargo, get in touch!

📚 Curious to know more?

  • Read more about connecting the world’s air cargo markets to make them more productive and successful.

  • Get to know Siena and Alex from the cargo.one team and find out more about daily challenges, most significant achievements and personal motivations. 

  • View cargo.one latest news from the industry.

  • Read about one of our latest partnership with Avianca Cargo.

jobs.title: Entrepreneur in Residence
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🏆 What’s the opportunity?

This role is a fantastic opportunity to learn how businesses are built from the ground up and to make an impact on a fast-growing tech company. You'll drive your own projects across all areas of the business, which could range from marketing to product, including business development, project management and more. You’ll get ownership of your tasks from day one and will be considered a full member of the team.

The projects you’ll carry will depend on both the company needs and your strengths and interests and for that reason, we are looking for a strong generalist with an interest in gaining experience from a start-up like ours, no matter what the project or team.

Successful EiRs will have the opportunity to join the team full-time after completing their internships. This internship's duration is 6 months.

🌍 You can work from (almost) anywhere in Europe, but we are predominantly looking for EiRs based in Berlin. We are a remote company with a HQ in Germany.

🎬 A snapshot of what you could be doing here :

  • You will be working with the business to scope out a new product focus for cargo.one.

  • Owning and running cross-functional meetings (product, marketing, enterprise commercial).

  • Supporting market and target customer research for large enterprise customers.

  • Building and maintaining pricing framework for enterprise products.

  • Planning and creating (together with marketing and design) an enterprise product overview and detailed product materials.

  • PLUS much more! We don't always know where our entrepreneurs will focus their time, it depends a lot on the priorities of the business for that quarter. But we do promise a lot of responsibility and a steep learning curve!

🙋🏽‍♀️ We are looking for someone who:

  • Has gained more than 1 year of experience in fast-paced and high-performance work environments such as VC-backed start-ups, consulting or investment banking.

  • Has recently completed an MBA or equivalent and is looking for some hands-on experience to support what you learnt.

  • Considers themselves a generalist and are open to working on a variety of cross-functional tasks.

  • Is proactive and thrives when working independently, even with minimal supervision.

  • Is willing to roll up their sleeves and do what needs to be done.

  • Is a quick learner and has great analytical skills and a structured way of thinking.

  • Has great interpersonal skills and is not afraid to defend your opinions.

  • Embraces uncertainty and displays a high level of adaptability.

  • Is willing to learn and open to accepting feedback, generously giving their own in return.

🤩 We believe you’ll enjoy working here if:

  • You value building great relationships and trust with your team and managers.

  • You love experimenting with new ideas and get super excited when you find an opportunity for process improvement.

  • You see working remotely successfully as a pioneering challenge which is constantly evolving.

  • In everything you do, you take ownership and get a kick out of exceeding expectations.

  • When faced with the choice, you’d rather opt for the ambitious to ensure you grow, than take the easy option.

  • You see the value of giving and receiving feedback and incorporate this into everything you do. You are not afraid to voice your opinions and like using data to back them up.

Feel free to check out the profiles of some of our past EiRs on LinkedIn to see what they are up to now! If you connect with them, don't forget to apply first through the official channels, as they are not always part of the interview process!

Check out Alex's journey here...

...or check Ricard's path as a Head of Engagement…

...and Veit as now our VP of Airline Sales!

Our hiring process for this EiR program includes:

  • a 20 minute video call with a Talent Partner.

  • a 60 min chat with the Co-CEO & Co-Founder covering some cultural alignment questions.

  • then a 60 minute Work Sample or a chat with a Senior Leader of a relevant department (depends on your skillset and interests).

  • informal ☕️ chats with the team members.

jobs.title: Senior People Leader
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🏆 The Opportunity 🏆

We are looking for a commercially minded Senior People Leader to build and lead a high-impact People function at a fast-growing, ambitious company. You will join a massively international team, with 110 Cargonauts of 40 nationalities working across 23 countries in a fully remote set up.

You’ll lead the people and talent team (currently 2 people) and work shoulder-to-shoulder with the leadership team to build and operationalise a people-first playbook that fuels our high-performance culture and drives real business outcomes. This role goes far beyond HR processes. You’ll dive in to build and launch initiatives that elevate every stage of the employee journey, and continuously iterate to keep our teams equipped, engaged, and empowered as we grow.

This is a unique, entrepreneurial opportunity to be driving the digitalization of air freight and logistics in a fast-growing Series B company backed by leading Venture Capital firms including Index and Bessemer.

We foster a positive, dynamic, hard-working and feedback-heavy culture, with a strong dose of playfulness. Our eSAT is a remarkable +51 , reflecting the strength of our culture. Join us now and transform the way airlines sell cargo!

🌍 This is a fully remote role so you can work from a permanent location (almost) anywhere within 2 hours of CET. See which countries we can employ in currently by checking out this list here.

We also offer flexible workspace options: if you’re based in Berlin, you’re welcome to join other Cargonauts at our office near Moritzplatz. In other cities, we provide coworking space access through Desana. While we’re fully remote, we regularly bring the whole company together for offsites, where everyone meets in person to connect, collaborate, and tackle big challenges as a team.

🎬 A snapshot of what you will be doing here:

  • Translate business goals into a performance-focused people strategy: Collaborate with founders and department heads to design organizational structures, talent priorities, and processes that attract high performers and empower them to excel in our fast-paced environment.

  • Partner on strategic talent planning and organisational design: Collaborate closely with our Senior Talent Partner and team leaders to align on future talent needs, assess skill gaps across the organisation, and prioritise hiring plans. Your role will focus on ensuring our organisational structure, capabilities, and operating rhythms are designed to support scalable, high-performing teams while enabling the Talent team to continue delivering excellence in execution.

  • Own the end-to-end employee journey: From high-impact onboarding experiences that set new hires up for success, to ongoing performance frameworks, entrepreneurial career paths, and compensation models, ensuring every stage drives peak performance and alignment with our values and North Star goals.

  • Maximize People team impact through automation and innovation: Leverage AI, tech stack optimizations, and process automation (HRIS, ATS, analytics) to amplify our lean team’s reach - enabling us to do more with existing resources while maintaining high standards.

  • Design for scalable impact, not just headcount: Build thoughtful structures and workflows that remove blockers, streamline collaboration, and enable every team to achieve more.

  • Be the central hub for all people-related challenges: Act as the trusted advisor for leadership and individual contributors alike - navigating complex employee relations, performance conversations, and strategic pivots with clarity and decisiveness.

  • Drive data-informed performance improvements: Define, track, and interpret key metrics (e.g., turnover risk indicators, time-to-impact for new hires, engagement signals) to continuously refine programs and ensure we’re enabling top-tier performance.

  • Partner across functions to unblock impact: Work closely with Finance, Legal and external partners to align Total Rewards, policies, and org designs with budget realities and regulatory demands - ensuring rapid decision-making without bureaucracy.

🕵 We are looking for individuals who have:

  • 10+ years of People/HR experience, preferably more - including at least 4 years in a scaling startup or high-growth environment (preferably post-Series A/B and either, B2B SaaS or Marketplace), have worked in a fully remote or globally distributed set up, in an environment with headcount in the range of 200 - 2000 FTE.

  • Proven leadership of a People function: You’ve built, significantly reorganised or significantly scaled People teams at least twice, balancing strategic vision with hands-on execution in a lean setting.

  • Deep commercial acumen: You understand P&L dynamics, organisational strategy, and seek to understand our business model to best translate business objectives into robust people strategies that unlock performance.

  • Exceptional communication & EQ: You’re a strong writer and speaker, comfortable influencing stakeholders at every level and fostering trust across diverse teams.

  • Analytical and strategic mindset: You leverage data to diagnose challenges, propose solutions, and measure outcomes without shying away from diving into spreadsheets or HRIS dashboards (or building them) yourself.

  • Operator/builder mentality: You relish ambiguity, enjoy crafting processes from first principles, and aren’t afraid to own both high-level strategy and detailed execution.

  • High standards and growth mindset: You push yourself (and others) to continuously improve, experiment with new ideas, and stay curious about best practices in people and culture.

  • Strong sense of ownership and resilience: You can thrive under autonomy, adapt quickly to change, and make confident decisions even when all information isn’t yet known.

  • You are willing to learn and open to accepting feedback, generously giving your own in return.

💫 Nice to haves:

  • Knowledge of the German legal system plus one other jurisdiction

  • German language is a plus

❤️ We think you will love working here if:

  • You believe that building a stellar team is as important as building a stellar product.

  • You’re excited to think and act like a founder in the People space, continually iterating on how we hire, develop, and retain top talent - embodying our leitmotif to "Take ownership. Move beyond the ordinary. Exceed expectations."

  • You thrive when given high autonomy and can navigate rapid change without losing sight of long-term objectives. We regularly publish strategy papers and expect Cargonauts to plan and execute their work to meet the North Star goals - which is why "I know how my work supports the goals of cargo.one" consistently ranks as our top survey response.

  • You hold yourself (and everyone around you) to high standards and are always looking for creative ways to make work better, faster and stronger.

  • When faced with the choice, you’d rather opt for the ambitious to ensure you grow, than take the easy option - 82% of Cargonauts scored 8/10 or higher when asked if they believe their role enables them to learn and develop new skills.

  • You see the value of giving and receiving feedback and incorporate this into everything you do. This isn't just talk - our engagement surveys consistently rank "My manager cares about my opinions" and "My co-workers are open to opinions different from their own" among our highest scores.

  • You are not afraid to voice your opinions and like using data to back them up. One of our most cherished leitmotifs is "Show backbone. Reject bullshit," and you'll see this lived out in our daily work.

🤔 What is so exciting about working in the air cargo industry?

Imagine trying to book a holiday without Skyscanner or Kayak—that’s exactly the challenge facing the air cargo industry today. Despite being a $182bn global market, air cargo is still dominated by manual, time-consuming processes. We’re changing that. Backed by leading international investors, we’re building the tech platform that brings transparency and instant booking to airlines and freight forwarders worldwide.

You’ll join a truly international team, working with partners and customers across the globe, and help drive the digital transformation of one of the last major industries yet to modernize. If you want to have a real impact at the forefront of change, we’d love to hear from you.

Curious to know more?

Read more about connecting the world’s air cargo markets to make them more productive and successful.

Get to know Siena, Alex, and Bogna from the cargo.one team and find out more about daily challenges, most significant achievements and personal motivations.

View cargo.one latest news and some of our newest cargonauts from the industry.

Click here to view a video from one of our offsites.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
🏆 What’s the Opportunity?

In this role, you’ll tackle challenges that go beyond traditional recruiting. As a remote-first company, we are constantly innovating to reach globally dispersed talent and create genuine connections throughout the hiring process.

You’ll play a pivotal role in shaping new teams, understanding their impact on the business, and developing hiring strategies that drive team and company growth. Acting as a trusted consultant and advisor, you’ll provide insights on market trends, share data-driven recommendations, and showcase your expertise in innovative sourcing techniques and process automation.

Our People team is small but mighty, with a mission to become a best-in-class team that attracts and nurtures exceptional talent worldwide. From day one, you’ll have the opportunity to bring your technical expertise, take ownership, and make a meaningful impact.

This is a unique opportunity to be driving the digitalization of air freight and logistics in a fast-growing Series B company backed by leading Venture Capital firms including Index and Bessemer.

🎬 A snapshot of what you will be doing here:

  • Partnering with senior leadership and hiring managers on complex requirements, shaping the teams that define the future of our company.

  • Owning high-impact searches in a fast-moving startup environment, ensuring we hire the right talent at the right time.

  • Building scalable recruitment processes with a strong focus on automation and efficiency.

  • Acting as a trusted advisor, providing data-driven insights on hiring strategies, market trends, and workforce planning.

  • Coaching and supporting hiring managers across all levels to make confident hiring decisions.

  • Bringing creativity and innovation to sourcing, while delivering an exceptional candidate experience.

  • Optimizing a fully remote hiring approach that sets industry standards for distributed teams.

  • Leveraging Ashby to its fullest potential, driving adoption, automation, and data-driven decision-making across our hiring processes.

  • Building strategic talent pipelines by engaging with industry communities, universities, and networks.

  • Supporting People team projects, improving processes, and rolling out new tools for scalability and global impact.

  • Shaping our employer brand and talent positioning to attract world-class talent.

🙋🏽‍♀️ What you’ll need:

  • At least 5 years of recruitment experience, ideally in a mix of agency and high-growth in-house recruiting.

  • Strong track record hiring for GTM roles (sales, success, partnerships, marketing) in a startup or scale-up environment.

  • Proven experience working fully remote and thriving in a distributed, asynchronous team culture.

  • Excellent stakeholder management skills, with experience handling senior leaders and complex requirements.

  • Deep hands-on expertise with Ashby (ATS), with a strong ability to drive automation and improve hiring workflows.

  • A technical mindset: comfortable with systems, processes, and data, and able to optimize for efficiency and scale.

  • A proactive, independent, and self-motivated approach, with the ability to manage multiple hiring processes at once.

  • A growth mindset, resilience, and adaptability in environments of shifting priorities.

  • Strong communication skills and fluent English, written and spoken.

❤️ We think you will love working here if:

  • You enjoy working directly with senior stakeholders and thrive in fast-changing, high-growth environments.

  • You are excited by the challenge of building processes from scratch and scaling them globally.

  • You value building strong, trust-based relationships across the business.

  • You love experimenting with new tools, automation, and approaches to hiring.

  • You embrace feedback and use it to grow.

  • You see remote work as an opportunity to innovate, not a limitation.

📚 Curious to know more?

  • Read more about connecting the world’s air cargo markets to make them more productive and successful.

  • Get to know Siena and Alex from the cargo.one team and find out more about daily challenges, most significant achievements and personal motivations.

  • View cargo.one latest news.

  • Click here to view a video from one of our offsites.

  • Provide valuable feedback to our product team based on customer insights, helping shape the future of our offerings.

  • Tech Proficiency: Strong understanding of digital tools and platforms, with the ability to quickly grasp new technologies.

  • Communication Excellence: Exceptional written and verbal communication skills to engage diverse audiences and build rapport.

  • Analytical Thinking: Ability to analyze customer workflows and offer tailored solutions aligned with business objectives.

  • Native or equivalent in Italian

  • You see working remotely successfully as a pioneering challenge which is constantly evolving.

You will experience a culture of open communication, providing and receiving insightful feedback during retrospectives, one-on-ones, and regular performance reviews.

  • We aim to have continuous deployment pipelines and code that goes into production extremely fast. We can deploy several times daily today, but a few manual steps are still involved. We are constantly expanding our automated tests and refining log messages, metrics, distributed tracing, and alerts to move closer to the desired level of automation and observability.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
🏆 What’s the opportunity?

Curious about how great companies run behind the scenes? Want to get your hands dirty in real People Ops, not just busywork?

We’re looking for someone ambitious and detail-oriented to join our People team, supporting everything from recruitment coordination and onboarding to employee experience and process improvement. This is more than just an HR admin role - it’s a launchpad into the world of People Operations inside one of Europe’s most global and dynamic startups.

At cargo.one, you’ll be joining a team of 110 Cargonauts representing 40 nationalities, working across 23 countries. We move fast, give feedback often, and mix high standards with a strong sense of play. Our employee satisfaction score? A standout +51.

You’ll have a meaningful impact from day one, learn from sharp teammates, and help shape the experience of every person who joins after you. If you’re proactive, organised, and eager to grow, this is your chance to be in the room where it happens.

📍 You’ll need to be based in Berlin 🇩🇪 and available to work from our hub near Moritzplatz as needed.

🎬 A snapshot of what you will be doing here (and why it’s exciting!)

This is not your average working student gig.

You’ll be a vital force in making sure our People Operations run smoothly - but also in making them smarter, faster, and more human. You'll get hands-on experience across the full employee lifecycle and have the freedom to improve how we do things at every step.

You’ll work on:

  • Running key People processes (and making them better)
    From onboarding new teammates to helping offboard leavers, you’ll make sure every touchpoint is smooth and thoughtful. You'll also spot friction and improve how we do things, so each experience gets better over time.

  • Solving real problems, not just answering tickets
    Of course you’ll support employees with questions about systems, policies, contracts, and more - but we’ll count on you to go a step further: spot patterns, fix root causes, and keep improving the knowledge base.

  • Owning the accuracy of our people data
    You'll help maintain and clean our HRIS and other tools to support strong decisions and smooth operations across the org.

  • Creating clarity at scale
    Whether it’s updating onboarding materials, writing internal guides, or documenting new processes, you’ll help us scale knowledge and reduce ambiguity as we grow.

  • Supporting recruitment with precision and speed
    You’ll assist with scheduling, contracts, and logistics and look for ways to make it faster, clearer, and more delightful for candidates and hiring teams alike.

This role is ideal for someone who’s people-obsessed, eager to learn by doing, and excited to leave every process better than they found it. If you love systems, take ownership naturally, and want to stretch beyond just admin, you’ll thrive here.

🙋🏽‍♀️ What we are looking for...

This role is about growth, grit, and getting things done rather than taking orders and ticking boxes. We're looking for someone who’s smart, driven, and excited to make things better every day.

You might be a fit if:

  • You're based in Berlin (mandatory)

  • You’re currently enrolled in a university program in HR, Business, Psychology, Law, or something else that sharpens how you think and communicate.

  • You’re naturally curious and self-driven. You don’t wait to be told what to do, and you love figuring things out.

  • You’re calm in chaos. Ambiguity doesn’t scare you; it energizes you to bring structure and clarity.

  • You’re a problem solver at heart - you don’t just spot issues, you suggest better ways to do things.

  • You’ve got strong attention to detail and high standards.

  • You communicate with clarity, warmth, and confidence - even when you don’t have all the answers.

  • You love tools and systems and maybe even enjoy tinkering with them to simplify work. (Bonus if you’ve worked with Personio, Leapsome, Notion, Google Sheets or similar tools.)

Above all, you're energised by doing real work that matters, and you're excited to learn fast by being part of a high-performing team.

✨ We are offering

  • Flexible working hours to fit your studies.

  • The opportunity to take ownership of meaningful projects and see the impact of your work.

  • A supportive, curious, and collaborative team that values your input.

  • Hands-on experience in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.

  • The chance to grow and learn alongside a company that’s transforming an industry.

❤️ We think you will love working here if:

  • You thrive on ownership: You love taking responsibility, driving projects forward, and seeing your impact, especially when it comes to improving and streamlining processes.

  • You’re curious and solution-driven: You ask “Why?” and enjoy finding smarter ways to do things, from streamlining workflows to creating a better onboarding experience.

  • You value collaboration: You enjoy working with others across teams to build seamless, scalable People Operations processes.

  • You embrace a “win or learn” mindset: You see challenges as opportunities to grow and aren’t afraid to experiment or learn from mistakes.

  • You want to make a difference: You’re excited to help our People team mature and create systems that support a growing company.

🚀 About cargo.one

At cargo.one, we’re revolutionizing air cargo by making it digital, efficient, and customer-focused. Our platform connects airlines and freight forwarders seamlessly, and our team is the driving force behind this transformation.

We believe in ownership, collaboration, and continuous improvement, and we’re looking for a working student to join our People team who shares these values.

  • Get to know Siena and Alex from the cargo.one team and find out more about daily challenges, most significant achievements and personal motivations. 

  • View cargo.one latest news from the industry.

  • Read about one of our partnership with Avianca Cargo.

Full-Stack Engineer

Location: Remote (within EMEA)
Team: Product & Engineering
Seniority: Mid–Senior
Type: Full-time

Transform global air logistics — one line of code at a time.
cargo.one is on a mission to revolutionise air cargo — an industry worth $123B — by bringing seamless digital infrastructure to airlines and freight forwarders. Backed by leading VCs like Index and Bessemer, we're scaling fast and building out our world-class engineering team.

We’re looking for a Full-Stack Engineer to join us in building tools, infrastructure, and user experiences that drive speed, automation, and quality across our platform. If you're excited about tackling complex technical challenges in a truly global, remote-first company — let’s talk.

What you’ll do:

  • Work across the stack with Python (Flask) and JavaScript (Vue.js), as well as PostgreSQL, Redis, gRPC, Celery, and GCP

  • Design, build, and deploy new features in collaboration with product, design, and operational teams

  • Drive architectural decisions and help evolve our microservices and CI/CD pipeline

  • Build internal tooling to help our colleagues work smarter, not harder

  • Own your code end-to-end: from implementation to monitoring and performance

  • Participate in code reviews, retros, and open feedback culture

  • Help us move from “manual” to “magic” — automating and simplifying wherever possible

What we’re looking for:

  • 5+ years of engineering experience (we care more about impact than job titles)

  • Solid Python skills and professional experience with JavaScript frameworks

  • Good understanding of SQL and web application architecture

  • Passion for clean, testable, well-documented code

  • Curiosity and proactivity — you ask “why?”, challenge assumptions, and improve systems

Job Title: Enterprise Account Executive / Senior Enterprise Account Executive
Location: Remote – Europe

The Opportunity

As an Account Executive at cargo.one, you’ll be a core contributor to scaling our enterprise business. You’ll help freight forwarders build conviction that cargo.one is the right digital partner—from compelling first pitch to successful closing. You’ll engage with senior and middle management, consult on change, design solutions, and form consensus across key accounts.

This is a unique opportunity to drive the digital transformation of the air cargo industry within a fast-growing, Series B company backed by leading VCs including Index Ventures and Bessemer Venture Partners.

  • Manage a portfolio of enterprise relationships from discovery through to solution design, negotiation, and close.

  • Lead account planning in partnership with marketing, lead generation, and pre-sales, helping to prioritise pipeline and target accounts.

  • Deliver compelling sales pitches and materials, effectively managing complex relationships throughout the sales cycle.

  • Use a proactive, consultative approach to build sustainable stakeholder relationships.

  • Represent cargo.one at trade shows, industry events, and customer engagements.

  • Experience as an Account Executive or Consultant in a fast-growing, venture-backed B2B technology company.

  • Exposure to enterprise sales cycles and complex buying processes.

  • Technologically curious and capable of understanding customer needs and product architecture.

  • See remote work as an opportunity to pioneer new ways of collaborating.

VP Customer Success & Expansion

cargo.one is transforming how freight forwarders access, quote, book, and manage air cargo capacity. As a remote-first, high-growth company, we’re passionate about ownership, customer obsession, and data-driven execution. Join us as we redefine the future of global logistics.

The Opportunity

As Head of / VP Customer Success & Expansion, you’ll shape and execute our post-sale strategy for both SMB and Enterprise customers. Reporting directly to the CCO, you’ll lead two ambitious, high-impact teams—Account Management and Customer Success—to deliver world-class customer outcomes, maximize Net Revenue Retention (NRR), and drive expansion within existing accounts. You’ll collaborate closely with Sales, Product, Marketing, and Finance, influencing the direction of our platform and the experience of our customers worldwide.

What You’ll Do

  • Lead and inspire: Build, mentor, and scale high-performing teams across Enterprise and SMB, fostering a culture of learning, ownership, and growth.

  • Drive customer outcomes: Own and exceed NRR goals, focusing on retention, expansion, and churn mitigation through data-driven strategies.

  • Streamline and innovate: Develop scalable processes, playbooks, and automation to optimize onboarding, account management, and customer success.

  • Champion customer insights: Leverage customer feedback and usage data to inform product development and strategic decisions.

  • Collaborate and influence: Partner with the CCO and cross-functional leaders to shape our customer journey and go-to-market strategy.

Success in Your First Year

  • You’ve consistently hit or exceeded NRR targets for both SMB and Enterprise segments.

  • Your teams operate with clear goals, scalable processes, and high morale.

  • You’ve established robust feedback loops between customers and product, resulting in measurable improvements.

  • Customers consistently report high satisfaction and engagement.

What You Bring

  • 8+ years in customer success, account management, or post-sales leadership in SaaS or technology, including 3–5+ years in senior roles.

  • Proven success owning NRR, retention, and expansion targets across diverse customer segments.

  • Experience building and scaling teams and processes in fast-growth or startup environments.

  • Analytical mindset; comfortable with dashboards, segmentation, and forecasting.

  • Outstanding communication and stakeholder management skills.

  • Experience in logistics, supply chain, or freight forwarding is a plus, but not required.

  • Comfortable leading remote, distributed teams.

Why Join Us?

  • Make your mark: Directly shape customer-led growth as a core pillar of our business.

  • Autonomy: Freedom to build, iterate, and innovate.

  • Culture: Collaborative, transparent, and feedback-driven environment.

  • Remote-first: Flexibility to work with talented teams across the globe.

  • Impact: Help redefine the future of air cargo.

Ready to help build the future of air cargo?
Join cargo.one and lead the charge in customer success and expansion
